item.title: Bitcoin pops then drops as Supreme Court strikes down Trump tariffs
item.description: As has been typical in crypto markets of late, even the most modest move higher was met with immediate selling.

item.title: Netherlands Bans Polymarket Over ‚ÄòIllegal Gambling Services‚Äô
item.description: Dutch regulator the Netherlands Gambling Authority this week ordered the prediction market to halt operations immediately.

item.description: Crypto, real estate and politics collided at Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago club as insiders debated tokenization and regulation.

item.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: CoinDesk 20 performance update: AAVE falls 3.3%, leading index lower
item.description: Bitcoin Cash (BCH), down 2.1% from Thursday, was also among the underperformers.

item.title: Tennessee judge issues injunction blocking state move against Kalshi
item.description: US Federal Judge Aleta Trauger granted Kalshi a preliminary injunction against Tennessee, finding its sports event contracts fall under CFTC jurisdiction.

item.title: Morning Minute: Base Breaks Up With Optimism
item.description: Base is taking their ball (onchain revenue) and going home (to their own chain).

item.title: Stablecoin A7A5 grows parallel system for sanctioned companies
item.description: Stablecoin ecosystem A7A5 has faced accusations of sanctions evasion and, according to some analysts, is creating an alternative, sanctions-free financial network.

item.title: What next for XRP as volatility sinks to 2024 lows
item.description: Technical traders see a compression setup, with $1.39 as key support and $1.44 as near-term resistance that could open a move toward $1.50 to $1.62 if reclaimed.

item.title: House Democrats press Treasury on World Liberty bank charter and UAE stake
item.description: House Democrats are pressing Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent over World Liberty Financial‚Äôs push for a national trust bank charter, citing systemic risk.

item.title: Tether USDT supply set for biggest monthly decline since 2022 FTX collapse
item.description: Tether‚Äôs USDT is nearing its largest monthly supply drop since the collapse of FTX, with whales and smart money traders continuing to reduce their USDT holdings.

item.title: Bitcoin ETFs shed $166M as BTC heads for worst start in years
item.description: Spot Bitcoin ETFs are approaching a five-week outflow streak, with $2.7 billion in net redemptions year-to-date, as BTC posts one of its weakest starts to a year.

item.title: Dual South Korean listings send Ethereum layer-2 token AZTEC surging 82%
item.description: Korean exchanges Upbit and Bithumb both added local currency pairs for the privacy-focused layer-2 token, triggering a sharp move in a thinly traded market.

item.title: Panic premium lingers in options even as bitcoin recovers from lows
item.description: Bitcoin rebounded above $68,000 as ETF outflows hit $6.8 billion and funding flips positive. A break above $72,000 is needed to confirm a bullish shift.

item.title: Bitcoin nears $68,000, gold jumps as U.S.-Iran tensions return

item.title: Crypto miner Bitdeer tanks 17% after $300M debt offering

item.title: CME Will Make Crypto Derivatives Trading 24/7 in May as Wall Street Eyes Similar Goal
